title: Kyle Rittenhouse case: Why it so divides the US
description: Few US trials in recent years have generated such debate and acrimony. Why this one?

title: Melanie Sykes and Christine McGuinness praised for openness about autism diagnosis
description: Charities say Melanie Sykes and Christine McGuinness are creating a conversation about autism.

title: Dan Roan: Cricket's racism scandal forces society to confront issues
description: BBC sports editor Dan Roan discusses the racism scandal in English cricket and how it forces society to confront its most important issues.

title: The whisky expert who fears losing his senses to Covid
description: Blair Bowman is living in a self-imposed lockdown amid fears he could lose his livelihood to the virus.

title: Covid passes: Swansea cinema told to close for defying law
description: Cinema owner Anna Redfern says she has been told to close after refusing to ask for Covid passes.

title: Andrew Marr to leave BBC to 'get own voice back'
description: He will join media giant Global, which owns radio stations including LBC, and write for newspapers.

title: Workers offered unlimited holiday to stop burnout
description: Stockbroking firm FinnCap says staff must take at least four weeks off from next year.

title: DR Congo data leak: Millions transferred to Joseph Kabila allies
description: Family and friends of former DR Congo President Joseph Kabila are named by Africa's biggest data leak.

title: Hamas to be declared a terrorist group by UK
description: The change will cover the entirety of the Palestinian militant group, including its political wings.

title: Austria to go into full lockdown as Covid surges
description: As well as Monday's lockdown, the chancellor says vaccinations will be compulsory from February.

title: Mercedes review request of Verstappen Brazil move rejected
description: Formula 1 officials have rejected Mercedes' request for a review of Max Verstappen's driving during the Sao Paulo Grand Prix.

title: Six million Sky routers had serious security flaw
description: The issue, which could have let hackers take over home networks, took 18 months to fix, researchers say.

title: Liverpool bomb: Homemade device used ball bearings as shrapnel, police say
description: Emad Al Swealmeen's homemade device could have "caused significant injury or death", police say.

title: Jimmy Hoffa: Deathbed confession sparks long-missing US union boss body hunt
description: The FBI search a site in New Jersey as a new clue leads to hopes of solving the decades-old case.

title: Stephen Port: Met Police apologises to families of victims of serial killer
description: Deputy Assistant Commissioner Stuart Cundy says the case is a "personal disappointment to me".

title: Strictly Come Dancing: Actress Cynthia Erivo to fill in as judge
description: Oscar-nominated Cynthia Erivo will replace Craig Revel-Horwood this weekend after he caught Covid.

title: Tearful Paine steps down as Australia Test captain over text messages to female colleague
description: Tim Paine steps down as Australia Test captain before the Ashes over a historical investigation into sexually explicit texts to a female colleague.

title: Comedian Janey Godley reveals she has ovarian cancer
description: The 60-year-old entertainer said she was diagnosed after suffering from a bloated feeling in her stomach.

title: Deforestation: Which countries are still cutting down trees?
description: World leaders have pledged to stop and reverse deforestation. How do their records stack up?

title: Azeem Rafiq: What England's cricket racism scandal is all about
description: Azeem Rafiq says he faced years of racist abuse while playing for Yorkshire Cricket Club.

title: The boom in buying a car without ever leaving your sofa
description: Covid changed our shopping habits but will it shift how we make one of our biggest purchases?

title: Alex Hales: Ex-England batter apologises for 'incredibly disrespectful' black make-up photo
description: Former England batter Alex Hales apologises for "all the offence" he has caused after a historical photo showing him wearing black make-up was published.

title: Tim Paine: Australia Test captain steps down over investigation into texts sent to female colleague
description: Tim Paine announces he is stepping down as Australia Test captain just before the Ashes following an investigation into texts sent to a female colleague in 2017.

title: Revenge, reinvention & the Rassie factor - why England v South Africa will be different this time
description: Two years have passed since South Africa beat England in the Rugby World Cup final - so what has changed to make Saturday's meeting so different?

title: 'I found I had breast cancer when I lost my voice'
description: An Edinburgh mother-of-two thought she had laryngitis when her voice turned to a "papery whisper".

title: Child marriage: 'I should've been protected'
description: Some MPs are planning to change the law to raise the minimum age of marriage to 18.

title: Cladding crisis: 'Some days I can't leave the house'
description: Research finds the cladding crisis is having a 'catastrophic mental health impact' on some leaseholders.

title: Climate change: Conspiracy theories found on foreign-language Wikipedia
description: Pages in languages other than English wrongly suggest scientists are divided over the causes of global warming.

title: Review: Adele's 30 finds her emotionally bewildered and at the top of her game
description: The star picks over the debris of her marriage, with some of the strongest songs of her career.

title: Why a French president hopeful is dredging up WW2
description: The TV pundit is a likely presidential candidate but his views on wartime history are controversial.

title: Malaysian transgender woman Nur Sajat: 'I had to run away'
description: Transgender woman Nur Sajat fled Malaysia after being charged with insulting Islam.

title: Felix Klieser: Playing the horn using my left foot
description: Musician Felix Klieser is the new artist in residence with the Bournemouth Symphony Orchestra.

title: Afghanistan: The teenage girls returning to school under the Taliban
description: The BBC's John Simpson visits Bamiyan and finds some girls are attending secondary school in Afghanistan.

title: Ros Atkins on... the missing Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai
description: Questions remain about the whereabouts of Peng Shuai, after she accused a top Chinese government official of sexual assault.
